column4: hi all. is there some way to control the cpu fan under ubuntu? i am on an asus w1000 machine
Yes there is. Google using the catchwords ACPI, fan, speed.
i am googling exactly these words.. but no result yet
did you manage to control it?
or why do you know, that it is possible with acpi?
Yes I did. It works fine with me.
does it work like echo "speed somevalue" > /proc/acpi/...=?
can you tell me  a bit more about how to do it=
anyway, it is good to hear, that it is possible

This is one possibility. But not the safest. -- I could tell you more but the matter is delicate because you may destroy your computer if done wrongly. Iwould advise you first to read a bit about ACPI basics.
i am already monitoring the cpu temperature...i don't think it is dangerous for me
so please tell me anyway how to do it
what manufacturer are you on? i mean your computer?
please don't bait me with some partial info in order to disappear afterwards...
